node.title: Councillor quartet rejects Northland regional landfill's statement of intent
node.description: A quartet of councillors has refused to fully support the operation of Northland's major regional landfill south of Whangārei.

node.title: Higher pay not enough to retain staff - Seek
node.description: The tight labour market and skills shortage was a challenge for would-be employers, with record low unemployment of 3.2 percent and annual wage growth the strongest since 2009.

node.title: Oscars 2022: Hollywood gears up for its biggest night
node.description: Hollywood is gearing up for its biggest night of the year, as the stars get ready to attend the 94th Academy Awards in Los Angeles later - and NZ-filmed The Power of the Dog is a frontrunner.

node.title: Hundreds more may die in first Omicron wave, Covid-19 modeller says
node.description: The Covid-19 death toll stands at 258 as of Sunday evening, but a modeller says hundreds more people could die in the first wave of the Omicron outbreak.

node.title: Govt boosts Air NZ pandemic support by up to $180 million
node.description: Air New Zealand is getting another 12 months of government support for cargo flights as the pandemic continues to disrupt international air passenger travel.

node.title: Oscars 2022: Red carpet arrivals at the 94th Academy Award
node.description: From Zoë Kravitz to Venus Williams, here's who showed up in a big way.

node.title: Erebus memorial: Ministry acted unreasonably by not consulting more widely on location - Chief Ombudsman
node.description: Site preparation began for the Auckland-based memorial in December.

node.title: House January 6 committee report recommends Trump aides be held in contempt of Congress
node.description: The full committee will vote on the recommendation on Monday.

node.title: Shortage of supplies hampering support of isolating Covid-19 cases in Taranaki
node.description: Taranaki has been averaging more than 600 new Covid-19 cases a day and there are about 4500 active cases in the community - 10 percent of which need support to isolate safely.

node.title: Auckland Council gets set to kick-off consultation on Māori seats
node.description: Auckland Council will start formal consultation with iwi and urban Māori from next month on the creation of Māori seats in time for the 2025 election.

node.title: Ukraine still fighting back a month after Russia began its invasion
node.description: Holly Williams reports from Ukraine, where Russia's ground invasion has been largely stymied by Ukrainian counter-attacks.

node.title: Taylor Hawkins: Drugs found in body of late Foo Fighters drummer
node.description: Foo Fighters drummer Taylor Hawkins had marijuana, opioids and other drugs in his system before he died, Colombian investigators say.

node.title: St. Peter's falls to UNC, ending historic March Madness run
node.description: The loss sets up the first ever meeting between UNC and Duke in the NCAA tournament.

node.title: Tairāwhiti contractors abused during repair work after flooding, civil defence says
node.description: In a statement on social media, Tairāwhiti Civil Defence said it was saddened to hear reports of abuse towards roading contractors repairing damaged roads in Tairāwhiti after severe flooding. Audio

node.title: Ōhakea Air Force base to hold two large hangars, workforce of 1200
node.description: Huge cranes are towering above the flat Manawatū countryside as construction of two hangars for new Air Force aircraft cruises at altitude.

node.title: Orion develops health data exchange for Saudi Arabia
node.description: Health software developer Orion Health is back on track after an unhappy time as stock exchange listed company.

node.title: Christchurch businesses 'excited about the border reopening'
node.description: New businesses in Christchurch are breathing a sigh of relief at the government's recent changes to Covid-19 restrictions, after a quiet few months setting up shop.

node.title: 'Devastated': Tokomaru Bay residents call on PM for action after flood
node.description: Tokomaru Bay locals are demanding action from the government after their community was cut in two by last week's severe flooding.

node.title: Platform connects workers to hospitality businesses facing shortages
node.description: Some hospitality businesses struggling to cover shifts while their staff are in isolation are plugging the gaps with an employee-sharing website.

node.title: The town that backed a child sex abuser
node.description: When a firefighter abused his young son, many in their small town refused to believe it. Fire and Emergency kept him on, and locals turned on the boy's mum, saying she'd made up the allegations.

node.title: Multiple rockets hit Lviv city in western Ukraine
node.description: Four rockets hit the western Ukrainian city of Lviv on Saturday, local officials said, in the most significant attack on the city since the start of the war with Russia.

node.title: Fair Pay Agreements 'fundamentally flawed' - BusinessNZ
node.description: BusinessNZ has run out patience with the government's plans to implement national compulsory fair pay agreements and will fight to block the scheme.

node.title: Z Energy inches closer to Australian ownership
node.description: Z Energy shareholders have overwhelmingly backed a deal to sell the business to Australian fuel company, Ampol, for close to $2 billion.

node.title: Construction worker killed in partial collapse of Boston parking garage
node.description: The worker was preparing the building for demolition when the partial collapse caused him to fall roughly nine stories.

node.title: England and West Indies claim last 2 World Cup semi-final spots
node.description: Holders England won their last group match in style and West Indies benefited from South Africa's thrilling victory over India to make the Women's World Cup semi-finals.

node.title: Focus on Politics: Media merger raises stakes for NZ journalism
node.description: Podcast - the government is pressing ahead with its planned mega media merger. Political reporter Katie Scotcher explores what it will mean for RNZ, TVNZ and the wider sector. Audio

node.title: Mystics fight back, Steel win big
node.description: With a stirring last quarter revival, the Northern Mystics came from behind for an inspired one-goal win over the Central Pulse in a high quality game.

node.title: Concerning head knock for Barrett
node.description: Beauden Barrett will be closely monitored after a concerning head knock, says Blues coach Leon MacDonald.

node.title: Oscars 2022: Could Apple's Coda win best picture?
node.description: Statistically, Coda should not be such a strong contender to win best picture at Monday's Oscars.

node.title: NZ Omicron death rate comparable to other countries - modeller
node.description: A Covid-19 modeller is hopeful Omicron hospitalisations have peaked and says New Zealand's death rate is at a comparable level to other countries during an Omicron wave.
